channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13017] Backport HBASE-12035 Keep table state in Meta to branch-1
item.description: Lets backport that feature to branch-1.0 adapting HBASE-12035
item.summary: Backport HBASE-12035 Keep table state in Meta to branch-1

status.description: This issue was once resolved, but the resolution was deemed incorrect. From here issues are either marked assigned or resolved.

comments.comment:
initial backported patch.
let's try and see what is broken.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12698157/HBASE-13017.patch
against master branch at commit a0f2bc07b27a4119c356b5e2d111cf8e93dfb00e.
ATTACHMENT ID: 12698157

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 74 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/12781//console

This message is automatically generated.

Include 'branch-1.0' in your patch name and it will run against the proper branch.

1.0.0 has sailed so it is too late for this backport, no? 1.1? But it is already in 1.1?

yeah, thougth that affected version can help .
fixing that. thanks for suggestion stack
that is against branch-1, so it seems against upcoming 1.1

stack Enis Soztutar, need some suggstion. We have some stuff around zk state (like org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.ZKTableStateClientSideReader) and all of them are Private audience.
I'm going to remove these things altogether. Does it sound good for 1.x branch?
Yes. Private and used internally but HBCK and Admin only. Go ahead and remove in branch-1 context
You agree Enis Soztutar?

Yes, we can shoot for 1.1. It will help with stability I think. Although 1.0 clients (and 0.98 clients) has to work still against 1.1 clusters, and also we have to havea migration. As long as we have those, I'm +1.

Current state is:
1. we have migration (server automatically gather states from zk and apply them to META, defaults to ENABLED)
2. clients will not see disabled status, that is because they go to zk directly but status updated in meta.
3. enable/disable rpc calls should work due of the fact, that master is responsible for enablding/disabling tables and
master should be upgraded.
4. rolling upgrade can be tricky, RS will use zk for table status checks, but generally there should be no admin
operations during rolling update, so I think that that will not be an issue.

looks like unless old client not used for admin operations with table
states most things should work.

stack, please, can you take a look why jenkins doesn't want to apply this patch. It seems locally ./dev-support/test-patch.sh runs well. thank you.

It seems jenkins doesn't want to fetch branch correctly?

It maybe because we do not nuke the contents of the git repo. Even if we fetch origin, we do not merge it back to the local branch. Let me fix it.
retry the run

stack, ok, hope it fixed in HBASE-13061
